title: Readers Share Postpartum Healthcare Gaps: ‘How Is There No Care During This Time?’
sub_head: A WSJ article about a reporter’s health crisis after giving birth prompted readers to recount their own experiences
body:
In a recent Wall Street Journal article, reporter Laura Kusisto detailed her dangerous postpartum experience, in which a life-threatening infection landed her back in the hospital two weeks after delivering a healthy baby boy. Readers wrote in to share their own experiences in response.


I was hospitalized 22 days after giving birth to my son this past December and also diagnosed with sepsis. I remember the days leading up to my hospitalization. Every symptom I googled was listed as a normal part of postpartum, so it took a fever and a near-fainting spell to finally get me to call my doctor. All I could think in those first six weeks was: “How is there no care during this time?” And I say this as someone who thinks very highly of my OB and who received incredible care throughout my pregnancy and when I was readmitted.
Lauren Palazzo Portland, Maine
